title: Sending to Remotes
text: projr supports three types remote destinations: GitHub Releases - Version-controlled releases attached GitHub repository Local directories - Local network-mounted directories (e.g., shared drives, cloud sync folders) OSF (Open Science Framework) - Open Science Framework storage (covered vignette) Important: Remote destinations activated production builds (projr_build_patch(), projr_build_minor(), projr_build_major()). Development builds (projr_build_dev()) never upload remotes.

title: Sending to Remotes
text: projr can archive different types project components: raw-data - Source data files (inputs) cache - Intermediate computation results output - Final analysis outputs (figures, tables) docs - Rendered documents (HTML, PDF) code - Git-tracked source files

title: Sending to Remotes
text: GitHub releases provide version-controlled storage attached repository. Prerequisites: project must Git repository connected GitHub need GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) repo scope Set authentication: run projr_instr_auth_github() instructions Adding GitHub remote: YAML equivalent: Parameters: Use @version placeholder project version (e.g., “raw-data-v0.1.0”) Spaces converted hyphens automatically Must unique within repository Must valid directory label _projr.yml Options: raw-data, cache, output, docs, code
code: library(projr)  # Add a GitHub release for raw data projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "raw-data-@version",   content = "raw-data" )  # Add a GitHub release for outputs   projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output" ) build:   github:     raw-data-release:       title: "raw-data-@version"       content: [raw-data]     output-release:       title: "output-@version"       content: [output]

title: Sending to Remotes
text: GitHub local remotes support customization parameters. control artifacts uploaded.

title: Sending to Remotes
text: Controls versions organized remote. structure = "archive" (default) - Creates separate versions build structure = "latest" - Overwrites location build use: Use "archive" version tracking reproducibility (recommended) Use "latest" always-current snapshots reduce storage
code: projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   structure = "archive" ) # Creates: v0.1.0, v0.2.0, v0.3.0, etc. projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-latest",   content = "output",   structure = "latest" ) # Always updates the same release

title: Sending to Remotes
text: Controls new versions created remote. send_cue = "-change" (default) - create version content changed send_cue = "always" - Create new version every build send_cue = "never" - Never upload (temporarily disable remote) use: Use "-change" (default) efficient archiving - skips unchanged content Use "always" want create release every version, even unchanged Use "never" temporarily disable without removing configuration Note: useful structure = "archive". structure = "latest", send_cue still affects whether upload occurs.
code: projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "raw-data-@version",   content = "raw-data",   send_cue = "if-change" ) # Skips upload if raw-data is unchanged since last version projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_cue = "always" ) # Creates release even if content is unchanged projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_cue = "never" ) # Remote configured but inactive

title: Sending to Remotes
text: Controls upload approach. send_strategy = "sync-diff" (default) - Upload changed/new files, remove deleted files send_strategy = "sync-purge" - Delete remote files, upload local files send_strategy = "upload-" - Upload files (may overwrite) send_strategy = "upload-missing" - upload files already remote use: Use "sync-diff" typical workflows (recommended default) Use "sync-purge" want ensure stale files remain Use "upload-" simplest logic Use "upload-missing" want add new files
code: projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_strategy = "sync-diff" ) # Most efficient - only transfers differences projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_strategy = "sync-purge" ) # Clean slate each time - ensures no stale files projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_strategy = "upload-all" ) # Simple but potentially redundant projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_strategy = "upload-missing" ) # Additive only - never removes files

title: Sending to Remotes
text: Controls projr determines ’s already remote. send_inspect = "manifest" (default) - Use manifest.csv file remote send_inspect = "file" - Download inspect actual files remote send_inspect = "none" - Treat remote empty (always upload everything) use: Use "manifest" efficiency (recommended default) Use "file" manifest unavailable want verify actual state Use "none" simplest approach send_strategy = "upload-"
code: projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_inspect = "manifest" ) # Fast and accurate - requires manifest.csv to be uploaded projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_inspect = "file" ) # Slower but doesn't rely on manifest projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   send_inspect = "none" ) # Simplest - no inspection needed

title: Sending to Remotes
code: # Raw data: Archive with if-change cue (data rarely changes) projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "raw-data-@version",   content = "raw-data",   structure = "archive",   send_cue = "if-change",   send_strategy = "sync-diff",   send_inspect = "manifest" )  # Output: Archive with always cue (track all versions) projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "output-@version",   content = "output",   structure = "archive",   send_cue = "always",   send_strategy = "sync-diff",   send_inspect = "manifest" )  # Docs: Latest structure (always want current) projr_yml_dest_add_github(   title = "docs-latest",   content = "docs",   structure = "latest",   send_cue = "always",   send_strategy = "sync-purge",   send_inspect = "none" )
